result.execSummary:
The defendant Jasper Rick Tillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant ordered to pay all costs & surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within 1 year of release from custody.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: to anyother sentence with Huber for work & treatment.
Defendant not eligible for Day Reporting Center or Electronic Monitoring.

As a convicted felon, defendant may never again posses a firearms or weapons.
Voting admonishment given.
DNA notification given

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jasper Rick Tillman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jasper Rick Tillman
Current: 4883 N. 24TH PLACE, Milwaukee, WI 53209-5630 United States  (Effective: 03-16-2016)
Prior: 3727 North 42nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Jasper Rick Tillman in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4
days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Not eligible for DRC or electronic monitoring.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within 1 year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Jasper Rick Tillman in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jasper Rick Tillman in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jasper Rick Tillman in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nathaniel Adamson for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/20/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jasper Rick Tillman in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jasper Rick Tillman in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
